intro: Hamosa francisquitensis, commonly known as the Franklin's hamosa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
